Welcome to pi_iot’s documentation!¶

Contents:

Code to read a switch and light an LED.

Based on code found at http://makezine.com/projects/tutorial-raspberry-pi-gpio-pins-and-python/ and at http://mitchtech.net/raspberry-pi-physical-gmail-notifier/ .

This code must be run as Superuser on the Raspberry Pi.

Dependencies¶

Need to:

  • sudo apt-get install python-dev
  • sudo apt-get install python-pip python2.7-dev
  • sudo apt-get install python-rpi.gpio
  • sudo pip install flask

Code¶

class pyBits.TalkToAPi¶

Simple code to talk to the low level bits of a Raspberry Pi

controlLED(ledState)¶

turns off or on a LED. The LED is pulled up to Vcc so it needs to be driven low to turn the LED on.

Parameters:ledState – True to turn the light on, false to turn light off
getGPIOLibVersion()¶

Returns the GPIO library version that is being used.

Returns:GPIO library version as a string
getSwitchValue()¶

Poll the value of a switch/pushbutton. Will probably replace this code later with an interrupt driven routine.

Returns:True if the switch is pressed, false if the switch is not pressed
stopUsingRPi()¶

Free up the Raspbetty Pi pins when you are done using them
